result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy C West was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
03/18/2015 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Must make payments each and every month in the amount determined by the Probation Agent. 
03/18/2015 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO PAY $100.00 PER MONTH TOWARDS RESTITUTION BY WAGE ASSIGNMENT TO BE ARRAIGNED BY THE PROBATION AGENT.

$250.00 cash bond to be applied. 
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not enter any Walmart or Sam's Club stores.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

supervisions.notes:
03/18/2015 AMENDED: COURT EXTENDS PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR.
Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy C West in court with attorney John G Hinde.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hinde recites agreement.  State moves to amend to 2 misdemeanor counts - Count 1 to misd. theft take & carry 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) and added Count 2 misd. theft possess 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) - Granted.  Guilty plea entered.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  State relates.  Attorney Hinde relates.  Court relates and orders:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence
6 months jail on each count - Concurrent - STAYED

1 year Probation
Restitution $698 - C-31 filed - Must make payments each and every month in amount determined by Probation Agent
Must not enter any Walmart or Sam's Club Stores
Court costs
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent

Defendant Jeremy C West in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant stands mute and court enters not guilty plea.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
of Judge
Arraignment on March 12, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
